          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class MyReactClass extends React.Component {\n  constructor(props){\n    super(props);\n\n    this.state = {\n      count: this.props.initialCount\n    };\n  }\n  \n  upCount() {\n    this.setState((prevState) => ({\n      count: prevState.count + 1\n    }));\n  }\n  \n  render() {\n    return (\n      <div>\n        Hello, {this.props.name}!<br />\n        You clicked the button {this.state.count} times.<br />\n        <button onClick={this.upCount}>Click here!</button>\n      </div>\n    );\n  }\n}\n\nMyReactClass.defaultProps = {\n  name: 'Bob',\n  initialCount: 0\n};"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The "],
              ["render()", [["c"]]],
              [
                " function should be a pure function of the component’s state and props. It returns a single element which represents the component during the rendering process and should either be a representation of a native DOM component (e.g. "
              ],
              ["<p />", [["c"]]],
              [
                ") or a composite component. If nothing should be rendered, it can return "
              ],
              ["null", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              ["undefined", [["c"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

              ["getInitialState()", [["c"]]],
              [
                " defines the initial state of the React component. The React framework will call this function and assign the return value to "
              ],
              ["this.state", [["c"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },
